thread.title: US skier Ligety wins season-opening World Cup giant slalom
thread.title_full: US skier Ligety wins season-opening World Cup giant slalom

title: US skier Ligety wins season-opening World Cup giant slalom
text:
US skier Ligety wins season-opening World Cup giant slalom - Western Mass News - WGGB/WSHM Member Center: In the Know US skier Ligety wins season-opening World Cup giant slalom (AP Photo/Giovanni Auletta). Ted Ligety, of the United States, takes the start during an alpine ski, men's World Cup giant slalom, in Soelden, Austria, Sunday, Oct. 25 2015. (AP Photo/Marco Trovati). Ted Ligety, of the United States, competes during the first run of an alpine ski, men's World Cup giant slalom in Soelden, Austria, Sunday, Oct. 25, 2015. (AP Photo/Marco Trovati). Austria's Marcel Hirscher competes during the first run of an alpine ski, men's World Cup giant slalom in Soelden, Austria, Sunday, Oct. 25, 2015. (AP Photo/Marco Trovati). France's Thomas Fanara competes during the first run of an alpine ski, men's World Cup giant slalom in Soelden, Austria, Sunday, Oct. 25, 2015. 
SOELDEN, Austria (AP) - Ted Ligety of the United States won the season-opening men's giant slalom on Sunday for his 25th career World Cup victory. 
The Olympic and world champion held on to his first-run lead to beat Thomas Fanara of France by 0.15 and Marcel Hirscher of Austria by 0.17. The rest of the field finished at least 1.90 seconds off the lead. 
It was Ligety's fourth win here. He has dominated the discipline since 2012 but was beaten for the GS title by Hirscher last year. 
Norwegians Aksel Lund Svindal and Kjetil Jansrud, expected to be Hirscher's closest competitors for the overall championship, finished more than four seconds off the lead in 24th and 25th respectively.
